intro: Tragia ivohibeensis, commonly known as the Madagascar spiderflower, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Tragia ivohibeensis is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native environment.
